title: Geth stoped on block 16817176 Error: invalid gas used (remote: 15624163 local: 15514979)
body:
#### System information

Geth version: Geth/v1.11.5-stable-a38f4108/linux-amd64/go1.20.2
CL client & version: e.g. lighthouse.4.0.1
OS & Version: Ubuntu 20
Commit hash : Block: 16817177 (0x378a3c04a25a349d570bd0bc1b05811b6805b2b9d0b26ee6ef3d6da92e35461a)
Error: invalid gas used (remote: 15624163 local: 15514979)

#### Expected behaviour
I simulated the problem about 10 times.
Now 3 servers stop at the same place. Blk: 16,817,176
I changed beacon to lighthouse.

#### Actual behaviour
I simulated the problem about 10 times.
Now 3 servers stop at the same place. Blk: 16,817,176
I changed beacon to lighthouse.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Sync geth from 0 block
Start lighthouse with:
./lighthouse bn --network=mainnet \
--execution-endpoint=http://127.0.0.1:8551 \
--execution-jwt=/d01/coins/eth/jwtsecret \
--datadir=../blockchain/ \
--http \
--http-address=0.0.0.0 \
--http-port=5052 \
--checkpoint-sync-url=https://beaconstate.info/ \
--debug-level=debug

I chahging --checkpoint-sync-url to another from 
https://eth-clients.github.io/checkpoint-sync-endpoints/#mainnet

#### Backtrace

````

VCS: a38f4108-20230321

It says that an unclean shutdown was detected - did the client get forced killed at any point? That could cause the db to become corrupted. It does seem strange to occur on the same block every time though.

Block is here: https://etherscan.io/block/16817177 The unclean shutdowns are quite a bit older (which doesn't mean too much since the db can be fried either way) What do you mean with on the same block @lightclient?
@MariusVanDerWijden OP says he simulated the problem ~10 times and always failed on same block.
Oh yeah I see. These three nodes, did you copy any data between them?
Yes. The archive was taken on March 1st. Stopped by geth with a normal exit. Then archived geth/chaindata
How can I quickly synchronize a node from 1 block? If I start from 1 block, it will take at least a week.

Help. 
How can I quickly synchronize a node from 1 block? If I start from 1 block, it will take at least a week.

By day sync to 2018-04-13 06:03:49

You can delete the state and retain the history, using `geth removdb` and type `n` if it asks you about the ancients (all others should be `y`) This means you need to download ~450GB less than normal.
Operation was successfully completed. In a day, the data was downloaded and the node was in working condition. Thanks everyone

Your very welcome . Did geth really stop on block I don't think how so care
to explain . Remote local -- V2 Walk through// client < get = git <

is it possible to specify a local node as a download peer?

I already have one working node. Can I synchronize the second node in the same way from the first one?
@lxgn you can use the rpc method `admin_addPeer` https://geth.ethereum.org/docs/interacting-with-geth/rpc/ns-admin
